FuncDef: This command configures the maximum number of prefixes that IS-IS can learn, and use to protect the system from a router that has accidentally advertised a large number of prefixes. If the number of prefixes reaches the configured percentage of this limit, an SNMP trap is sent. If the limit is exceeded, IS-IS will go into overload.

ParaDef.Info: Enables a warning message to be sent at the specified threshold percentage and also when the limit is exceeded. However, overload is not set when this parameter is configured.
The number of prefixes that can be learned expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 4294967296.
The threshold value (as a percentage) that triggers a warning message to be sent. Values-0 to 100.
The time in minutes before IS-IS is restarted. Values-1 to 1800.
Specifies that IS-IS should be restarted only after the execution of the clear router isis overload prefix-limit command.
